div.p: If you want to consume messages in a different order, or consume specific messages at the head, middle or tail of the queue, you can

ul.li: browse the messages using the QueueBrowser to find the JMSMessageID's of the messages you want to consume
create a new consumer with a selector matching the ID(s) you want.

div.p: e.g. here is an example selector

script.class: brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Default

div.p: Note that this is not a very efficient way of working with JMS (JMS is designed for consumers to be long lived objects working across many messageS), but it can be useful in certain situations.
Another option is just to use JMX directly to browse messages on a queue, process them and then delete them.
